text: If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life maimed than with two hands to go into Gehenna,* into the unquenchable fire. Mark 9:43

Monday marks one year since the Las Vegas shooting where 58 people died and hundreds more were injured. Nick Campbell and Sgt. Justin Van Nest’s stories are stark reminder that there are people still reliving that trauma every day.
https://twitter.com/nprmusic/status/1044263201691652096 QT @nprmusic October 1 marks one year since the single deadliest mass shooting in modern American history, and in many ways, Las Vegas is still reeling. https://www.npr.org/2018/09/23/649264345/one-year-after-the-las-vegas-shooting-2-survivors-remember?utm_source=twitter.com&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=nprmusic&utm_term=music&utm_content=20180924 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Dn33x1pXsAE0KvZ.jpg

We need a thorough, independent FBI investigation into claims of Brett Kavanaugh’s sexual misconduct. We can’t limit witnesses. We can’t limit the scope. The GOP is more interested in getting this over with than in getting to the truth. America deserves better. https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1046392743650627585 QT @nytimes President Trump has said the FBI would have "free rein" to investigate allegations against Kavanaugh. But former classmates who contradict Kavanaugh's testimony about drinking are among those not on the interview list. https://trib.al/GvM6Q0y

One in three Americans currently don’t have a quality local park within a 10-minute walk of their home. I introduced the Outdoors for All Act to change that. This Act would establish dedicated funding to help ensure all children can grow up experiencing the outdoors.
